snippet.title: Mega Duck ( Cougar Boy ) Railway Gameplay ( No Commentary )
snippet.description:
The Mega Duck WG-108 also known as Cougar Boy in is a handheld game console that was developed and manufactured by Hong Kong-based Welback Holdings 
through its Timlex International division and released in 1993 as a cheap alternative to the highly popular Nintendo Gameboy.


Mega Duck/Cougar Boy Technical Specifications

CPU: Specific 8-bit VLSI
RAM: 64KB
Screen size: 46 mm x 49 mm
Display: 4 shades of grey
Power Supply: DC 6V mains power (Atari Lynx adaptor works) or 4 x AA batteries
Sound: built-in speaker, headphones jack
Communications Port: 6-pin for 2-player link
Cartridge Port: 36-pin
System Development Status: Complete
System Release Status: Released
Platform: Mega Duck/Cougar Boy.



Around 30 Games were made for the unit which were

The Brick Wall
Street Rider
Bomb Disposer
Vex
Suleuman's Treasure
Arctic Zone
Magic Maze
Puppet Knight
Trap and Turn
Pile Wonder
Captain Knick Knack
Black Forest tale
Armour Force
Snake Roy
Railway
Beast Fighter
Ant Soldiers
2nd Space
Magic Tower
Worm Visitor
Duck Adventures
Electron World
Dice Block
Trouble Zone
Virus Attack
Five in one
Zipball
